oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Star Spangled Cross and the Pure Field of White
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four page sheet music includes a lithograph of a Confederate flag on the front cover.

George Dunn and Company was formed in 1863. He came to Wilmington, North Carolina, in early 1862. He later settled in Richmond, VA, where he was granted permission to print Confederate money and currency. He probably returned to Great Britain in early 1865. Julian A. Selby, a printer and newspaperman, lived in Columbia, South Carolina.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Subaltern
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Flags; Selby, Julian A., b. 1833
Sheet music covers; Music title pages; Music publishing industry; Patriotism
